text: <extra_id_0> Erythropoietin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent induction of hemoglobin synthesis in a cytokine - dependent cell line M-TAT .
M-TAT is a cytokine - dependent cell line with the potential to differentiate along the erythroid and megakaryocytic lineages .

We cultured M-TAT cells long term ( > 1 year ) in the continuous presence of <extra_id_0> erythropoietin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> EPO <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , <extra_id_0> granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , or <extra_id_0> stem cell factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> SCF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .
These long term cultures are referred to as M-TAT / EPO , M-TAT / GM-CSF , and M-TAT / SCF cells , respectively .

Hemoglobin concentration and gamma-globin and <extra_id_0> erythroid delta-aminolevulinate synthase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels were significantly higher in M-TAT / <extra_id_0> EPO <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cells than in M-TAT / <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cells .

text: When the supplemented cytokine was switched from <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to <extra_id_0> EPO <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , hemoglobin synthesis in M-TAT / <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cells increased rapidly ( within 5 h ) , and the level of <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA increased .

In contrast , the addition of <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to the M-TAT / <extra_id_0> EPO <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cell culture decreased the amount of hemoglobin , even in the presence of <extra_id_0> EPO <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , indicating that the <extra_id_0> EPO <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signal for erythroid differentiation is suppressed by <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Thus , erythroid development of M-TAT cells is promoted by <extra_id_0> EPO <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and suppressed by <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

These results support the hypothesis that <extra_id_0> EPO <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> actively influences the programming of gene expression required for erythroid progenitor cell differentiation .
